summary:
The universe is getting bigger over time; this is called its expansion. It's like stretching a rubber band, but in all directions. Galaxies move apart, but those close to each other stay together due to gravity. This idea is important in understanding the Big Bang theory.

A long time ago, the universe expanded really fast during a period called inflation. It's still expanding today, but much slower. Scientists think something called dark energy is making this happen. This expansion is like a rocket fuel pushing the universe to keep growing.
title: Expansion of the universe
